FuncDef:
The ip unr tag command sets a route tag for host routes of IPv4 users and network segment routes generated based on the Framed-Route attribute delivered by the RADIUS server in the AAA domain view.
The undo ip unr tag command cancels the setting.
By default, no route tag is set for host routes of IPv4 users or network segment routes generated based on the RADIUS-delivered Framed-Route attribute in the AAA domain.
CLIs: ip unr tag <tag-value> route-type host-route framed-route
undo ip unr tag [ <tag-value> route-type host-route framed-route ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a route tag.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295.

Examples: [*HUAWEI-aaa-huawei] ip unr tag 14 route-type host-route framed-route
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To allow the device to categorize and advertise host routes of IPv4 users and network segment routes generated based on the RADIUS-delivered Framed-Route attribute to different networks, run the ip unr tag command to set a route tag for the host routes and network segment routes. In this way, the device can import route tags based on routing policies and advertise different host routes of IPv4 users to different networks.
Precautions
If the ip unr tag command is run more than once, the latest configuration overrides the previous one. If the ip unr tag, unr tag (IPv4), and ip unr framed-route-tag commands are run, the ip unr tag command takes effect.
